001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping;
002
003import squidpony.ArrayTools;
004
005import squidpony.squidmath.GWTRNG;
006import squidpony.squidmath.GreasedRegion;
007import squidpony.squidmath.IRNG;
008import squidpony.squidmath.IntIntOrderedMap;
009import squidpony.squidmath.IntVLA;
010
011/**
012 * A room placing algorithm developed by Rayvolution for his game Fail To Hero, this was simple to implement but
013 * delivers complex connectivity. It is meant to ensure all rooms are connected, but usually not directly, and many
014 * routes need to wind throughout the map to get to a goal.
015 * <br>
016 * With {@link #roomWidth} and {@link #roomHeight} set to 3, and {@link #wallThickness} set to 2:
017 * <pre>{@code
018 * ┌────────────────────────────┐┌────────┐┌────────┐┌────────┐
019 * │............................││........││........││........│
020 * │............................││........││........││........│
021 * │............................││........││........││........│
022 * │...┌──────────┐...┌─────┐...││...┌┐...│└────┐...││...┌────┘
023 * │...│┌───┐┌────┘...│┌────┘...└┘...││...└────┐│...││...└────┐
024 * │...││...││........││.............││........││...││........│
025 * │...││...││........││.............││........││...││........│
026 * │...││...││........││.......<.....││........││...││........│
027 * └───┘│...││...┌────┘│...┌─────────┘└────────┘│...│└────┐...│
028 * ┌────┘...││...└────┐│...│┌───────────────────┘...└─────┘...│
029 * │........││........││...││.................................│
030 * │.......>││........││...││.................................│
031 * │........││........││...││.................................│
032 * │...┌────┘└────┐...│└───┘│...┌─────────────────────────────┘
033 * │...│┌────────┐│...└─────┘...└────┐┌───┐┌────────┐┌────────┐
034 * │...││........││..................││...││........││........│
035 * │...││........││..................││...││........││........│
036 * │...││........││..................││...││........││........│
037 * │...││...┌┐...│└────┐...┌─────────┘│...│└────┐...│└────┐...│
038 * │...││...││...└─────┘...│┌────────┐│...└────┐│...└─────┘...│
039 * │...││...││.............││........││........││.............│
040 * │...││...││.............││........││........││.............│
041 * │...││...││.............││........││........││.............│
042 * │...││...││...┌─────────┘│...┌┐...││...┌────┘│...┌─────┐...│
043 * │...└┘...││...└──────────┘...││...└┘...└─────┘...│┌────┘...│
044 * │........││..................││..................││........│
045 * │........││..................││..................││........│
046 * │........││..................││..................││........│
047 * └────────┘└──────────────────┘└──────────────────┘└────────┘
048 * }</pre>
049 * <br>
050 * With {@link #roomWidth}, {@link #roomHeight}, and {@link #wallThickness} all set to 1:
051 * <pre>{@code
052 * ┌───────────────┬─┬───────────┬─────┬───┬─────────┬─┬───┬─┐
053 * │...............│.│...........│.....│...│.........│.│...│.│
054 * │.┌──────────.┌─┘.│.┌──.────┬─┤.┌───┤.│.│.──┐.──┐.│.│.│.│.│
055 * │.│...........│.....│.......│.│.│...│.│.....│...│.│...│...│
056 * ├─┘.┌────.┌─┐.└─────┘.┌──.│.│.│.│.┌─┘.│.│.──┼───┤.└─┬─┘.│.│
057 * │...│.....│.│.........│...│.│...│.│...│.│...│...│...│...│.│
058 * │.┌─┴───┬─┘.│.┌──.┌───┤.──┤.│.┌─┤.│.┌─┴─┼─┐.│.│.└───┤.│.└─┤
059 * │.│.....│...│.│...│...│...│.│.│.│...│...│.│...│.....│.│...│
060 * ├─┤.│.│.│.──┘.│.│.└─┐.├───┤.│.│.│.──┤.│.│.│.──┤.│.│.│.└─┐.│
061 * │.│.│.│.......│.│...│.│...│.│.......│.│...│...│.│.│.│...│.│
062 * │.│.└─┼────.┌─┘.└───┘.│.│.└─┴─┬─┬──.├─┤.──┴───┼─┤.├─┴─┐.└─┤
063 * │.│...│>....│.........│.│.....│.│...│.│.......│.│.│...│...│
064 * │.└─┐.│.┌───┴────.│.│.│.└─┬───┘.│.┌─┘.├───┐.┌─┘.├─┘.│.│.│<│
065 * │...│.│.│.........│.│.....│.......│...│...│.│...│...│...│.│
066 * ├──.├─┼─┴──.│.│.┌─┘.├───┐.└──.──┬─┘.┌─┘.│.│.│.┌─┘.──┴───┤.│
067 * │...│.│.....│.│.│...│...│.......│...│...│...│.│.........│.│
068 * ├─┐.│.│.──┬─┘.├─┘.┌─┤.──┼───┐.│.│.│.└──.└───┤.│.│.┌─┐.│.│.│
069 * │.│...│...│...│...│.│...│...│.│.│.│.........│.│.│.│.│.│.│.│
070 * │.│.│.└─┬─┴─┬─┴─┬─┤.├──.│.──┘.│.│.├──────.│.│.└─┤.│.│.└─┤.│
071 * │...│...│...│...│.│.│.........│...│.......│.....│.│.│...│.│
072 * │.┌─┤.│.│.│.│.│.│.│.│.──┐.──┐.├──.└───────┴─────┘.│.├──.├─┤
073 * │.│.│.│.│.│.│.│...│.│...│...│.│...................│.│...│.│
074 * │.│.├─┘.│.│.│.├──.│.└───┴─┐.│.└───────┐.──┐.──┬─┐.│.│.──┘.│
075 * │.│.│.....│.│.│...│.......│.│.........│...│...│.│...│.....│
076 * ├─┘.│.┌──.│.└─┘.┌─┴────.│.│.├───────┐.└─┐.├──.│.└─┬─┘.┌──.│
077 * │.....│...│.....│.......│...│.......│...│.│.......│...│...│
078 * │.────┴─┐.├────.│.│.────┤.──┘.┌────.├───┘.│.┌────.├──.│.──┤
079 * │.......│.│.......│.....│.....│.....│.....│.│.....│...│...│
080 * └───────┴─┴───────┴─────┴─────┴─────┴─────┴─┴─────┴───┴───┘
081 * }</pre>
082 * <br>
083 * With {@link #divideRooms} set to 0.65:
084 * <pre>{@code
085 * ┌─────┬───────────┬───────────┬─────┬─────┬─────┬─────┬─────┐
086 * │.....+...........│...........│.....│.....│.....│.....+.....│
087 * │.....│...........│...........│.....+.....│.....│.....│.....│
088 * │.....│...........│...........+.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│
089 * │.....│...........│...........│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│
090 * │.....│.......................│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│
091 * │.....│.....┌─────┬───+─┬─────┼─────┼─────┼──+──┼────+┼──+──┤
092 * │.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│
093 * │.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│
094 * │.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│.....+.....│.....│.....│.....│
095 * │.....│.....│.....│.....│.....+.....│.....│.....│.....│.....│
096 * │.....│.....│.....│.....+.....│.....│.....+.....│.....│.....│
097 * ├────+┼───+─┼────+┼─────┴─────┴─────┘.....├─────┼─────┤.....│
098 * │.....│.....│.....│.......................│.....│....>│.....│
099 * │.....│.....│.....│.....│.................│.....│.....│.....│
100 * │.....│.....│..<..│.....│.................│.....│.....│.....│
101 * │.....│.....│.....+.....│.................│.....│.....+.....│
102 * │.....│.....│.....│.....│.................│.....│.....│.....│
103 * │.────┼────.├─────┼─────┴───────────┬────.├────.├──+──┼──+──┤
104 * │.....│.....│.....│.................│.....│.....│.....│.....│
105 * │.....│.....│.....│.................│.....│.....│.....│.....│
106 * │.....│.....│.....│.................│.....│.....│.....│.....│
107 * │.....│.....│.....│.................│.....│.....+.....│.....│
108 * │.....│.....+.....│.................│.....│.....│.....│.....│
109 * ├───+─┼─────┼───+─┼────+──────┐.....└+────┼─────┼─────┼─.───┤
110 * │.....│.....│.....│...........│...........│.....│.....+.....│
111 * │.....│.....│.....│...........│...........│...........│.....│
112 * │.....│.....│.....│...........│...........+.....│.....│.....│
113 * │.....│.....│.....│...........│...........│.....│.....│.....│
114 * │.....+.....│.....│...........│...........│.....│.....│.....│
115 * └─────┴─────┴─────┴───────────┴───────────┴─────┴─────┴─────┘
116 * }</pre>
117 * <br>
118 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 5/7/2019.
119 */
120public class ConnectingMapGenerator implements IDungeonGenerator {
121    
122    public int width;
123    public int height;
124    public int roomWidth;
125    public int roomHeight;
126    public int wallThickness;
127    public char[][] dungeon;
128    public int[][] environment;
129    public GreasedRegion region;
130    public double divideRooms;
131    private final transient GreasedRegion tempRegion;
132    public IRNG rng;
133
134    /**
135     * Calls {@link #ConnectingMapGenerator(int, int, int, int, IRNG, int)} with width 80, height 80, roomWidth 8,
136     * roomHeight 8, a new {@link GWTRNG} for random, and wallThickness 2.
137     */
138    public ConnectingMapGenerator()
139    {
140        this(80, 80, 8, 8, new GWTRNG(), 2);
141    }
142    /**
143     * Determines room width and room height by dividing width or height by 10; wallThickness is 2. 
144     * @param width total width of the map, in cells
145     * @param height total height of the map, in cells
146     * @param random an IRNG to make random choices for connecting rooms
147     */
148
149    public ConnectingMapGenerator(int width, int height, IRNG random)
150    {
151        this(width, height, width / 10, height / 10, random, 2);
152    }
153    /**
154     * Exactly like {@link #ConnectingMapGenerator(int, int, int, int, IRNG, int)} with wallThickness 2.
155     * @param width total width of the map, in cells
156     * @param height total height of the map, in cells
157     * @param roomWidth target width of each room, in cells; only counts the center floor area of a room
158     * @param roomHeight target height of each room, in cells; only counts the center floor area of a room
159     * @param random an IRNG to make random choices for connecting rooms
160     */
161    public ConnectingMapGenerator(int width, int height, int roomWidth, int roomHeight, IRNG random)
162    {
163        this(width, height, roomWidth, roomHeight, random, 2);
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * 
168     * @param width total width of the map, in cells
169     * @param height total height of the map, in cells
170     * @param roomWidth target width of each room, in cells; only counts the center floor area of a room
171     * @param roomHeight target height of each room, in cells; only counts the center floor area of a room
172     * @param random an IRNG to make random choices for connecting rooms
173     * @param wallThickness how thick a wall between two rooms should be, in cells; 1 is minimum, and this usually
174     *                      shouldn't be much more than roomWidth or roomHeight
175     */
176    public ConnectingMapGenerator(int width, int height, int roomWidth, int roomHeight, IRNG random, int wallThickness) {
177        this(width, height, roomWidth, roomHeight, random, wallThickness, 0.0);
178    }
179    /**
180     * 
181     * @param width total width of the map, in cells
182     * @param height total height of the map, in cells
183     * @param roomWidth target width of each room, in cells; only counts the center floor area of a room
184     * @param roomHeight target height of each room, in cells; only counts the center floor area of a room
185     * @param random an IRNG to make random choices for connecting rooms
186     * @param wallThickness how thick a wall between two rooms should be, in cells; 1 is minimum, and this usually
187     *                      shouldn't be much more than roomWidth or roomHeight
188     */
189    public ConnectingMapGenerator(int width, int height, int roomWidth, int roomHeight, IRNG random, int wallThickness,
190                                  double divideRooms)
191    {
192        this.width = Math.max(1, width);
193        this.height = Math.max(1, height);
194        this.region = new GreasedRegion(this.width, this.height);
195        tempRegion = new GreasedRegion(this.width, this.height);
196        this.roomWidth = Math.max(1, roomWidth);
197        this.roomHeight = Math.max(1, roomHeight);
198        this.wallThickness = Math.max(1, wallThickness);
199        dungeon = ArrayTools.fill(' ', this.width, this.height);
200        environment = new int[this.width][this.height];
201        this.divideRooms = divideRooms;
202        rng = random;
203    }
204    /**
205     * Generates a dungeon or other map as a 2D char array. Uses the convention of '#' representing a wall and '.'
206     * representing a bare floor, and also fills {@link #environment} with appropriate constants from DungeonUtility,
207     * like {@link DungeonUtility#ROOM_FLOOR} and {@link DungeonUtility#ROOM_WALL}.
208     * 
209     * @return a 2D char array representing a room-based map, using standard conventions for walls/floors
210     */
211    @Override
212    public char[][] generate() {
213        int gridWidth = (width + wallThickness - 2) / (roomWidth + wallThickness), gridHeight = (height + wallThickness - 2) / (roomHeight + wallThickness), gridMax = gridWidth * gridHeight;
214        if(gridWidth <= 0 || gridHeight <= 0)
215            return dungeon;
216        ArrayTools.fill(dungeon, '#');
217        ArrayTools.fill(environment, DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED);
218        region.resizeAndEmpty(width, height);
219        IntIntOrderedMap links = new IntIntOrderedMap(gridMax), surface = new IntIntOrderedMap(gridMax);
220        IntVLA choices = new IntVLA(4);
221        int dx = rng.nextSignedInt(gridWidth), dy = rng.nextSignedInt(gridHeight),
222                d = dy << 16 | dx;
223        links.put(d, 0);
224        surface.put(d, 0);
225        for (int i = 0; i < 15 && links.size() < gridMax && !surface.isEmpty(); i++) {
226            choices.clear();
227            if (dx < gridWidth - 1 && !links.containsKey(d + 1)) choices.add(1);
228            if (dy < gridHeight - 1 && !links.containsKey(d + 0x10000)) choices.add(2);
229            if (dx > 0 && !links.containsKey(d - 1)) choices.add(4);
230            if (dy > 0 && !links.containsKey(d - 0x10000)) choices.add(8);
231            if (choices.isEmpty()) {
232                surface.remove(d);
233                break;
234            }
235            int choice = choices.getRandomElement(rng);
236            links.replace(d, links.get(d) | choice);
237            if (choices.size == 1)
238                surface.remove(d);
239            switch (choice) {
240                case 1:
241                    d += 1;
242                    links.put(d, 4);
243                    surface.put(d, 4);
244                    break;
245                case 2:
246                    d += 0x10000;
247                    links.put(d, 8);
248                    surface.put(d, 8);
249                    break;
250                case 4:
251                    d -= 1;
252                    links.put(d, 1);
253                    surface.put(d, 1);
254                    break;
255                default:
256                    d -= 0x10000;
257                    links.put(d, 2);
258                    surface.put(d, 2);
259                    break;
260            }
261            dx = d & 0xFFFF;
262            dy = d >>> 16;
263        }
264        while(links.size() < gridMax)
265        {
266            d = surface.randomKey(rng);
267            dx = d & 0xFFFF;
268            dy = d >>> 16;
269            for (int i = 0; i < 5 && links.size() < gridMax && !surface.isEmpty(); i++) {
270                choices.clear();
271                if (dx < gridWidth - 1 && !links.containsKey(d + 1)) choices.add(1);
272                if (dy < gridHeight - 1 && !links.containsKey(d + 0x10000)) choices.add(2);
273                if (dx > 0 && !links.containsKey(d - 1)) choices.add(4);
274                if (dy > 0 && !links.containsKey(d - 0x10000)) choices.add(8);
275                if (choices.isEmpty()) {
276                    surface.remove(d);
277                    break;
278                }
279                int choice = choices.getRandomElement(rng);
280                links.replace(d, links.get(d) | choice);
281                if (choices.size == 1)
282                    surface.remove(d);
283                switch (choice) {
284                    case 1:
285                        d += 1;
286                        links.put(d, 4);
287                        surface.put(d, 4);
288                        break;
289                    case 2:
290                        d += 0x10000;
291                        links.put(d, 8);
292                        surface.put(d, 8);
293                        break;
294                    case 4:
295                        d -= 1;
296                        links.put(d, 1);
297                        surface.put(d, 1);
298                        break;
299                    default:
300                        d -= 0x10000;
301                        links.put(d, 2);
302                        surface.put(d, 2);
303                        break;
304                }
305                dx = d & 0xFFFF;
306                dy = d >>> 16;
307            }
308        }
309        for (int i = 0; i < links.size(); i++) {
310            d = links.keyAt(i);
311            dx = d & 0xFFFF;
312            dy = d >>> 16;
313            int conn = links.getAt(i);
314
315            region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness), 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness), roomWidth, roomHeight);
316            if (divideRooms > 0.0 && rng.nextDouble() < divideRooms) {
317                if ((conn & 1) != 0)
318                {
319                    region.removeRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) + roomWidth, 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness), wallThickness, roomHeight);
320                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) + roomWidth, 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) + rng.nextSignedInt(roomHeight), wallThickness, 1);
321                }
322                if ((conn & 2) != 0)
323                {
324                    region.removeRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness), 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) + roomHeight, roomWidth, wallThickness);
325                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) + rng.nextSignedInt(roomWidth), 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) + roomHeight, 1, wallThickness);
326                }
327                if ((conn & 4) != 0)
328                {
329                    region.removeRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) - wallThickness, 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness), wallThickness, roomHeight);
330                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) - wallThickness, 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) + rng.nextSignedInt(roomHeight), wallThickness, 1);
331                }
332                if ((conn & 8) != 0)
333                {
334                    region.removeRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness), 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) - wallThickness, roomWidth, wallThickness);
335                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) + rng.nextSignedInt(roomWidth), 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) - wallThickness, 1, wallThickness);
336                }
337            } else {
338                if ((conn & 1) != 0)
339                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) + roomWidth, 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness), wallThickness, roomHeight);
340                if ((conn & 2) != 0)
341                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness), 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) + roomHeight, roomWidth, wallThickness);
342                if ((conn & 4) != 0)
343                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness) - wallThickness, 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness), wallThickness, roomHeight);
344                if ((conn & 8) != 0)
345                    region.insertRectangle(1 + dx * (roomWidth + wallThickness), 1 + dy * (roomHeight + wallThickness) - wallThickness, roomWidth, wallThickness);
346            }
347        }
348        region.writeCharsInto(dungeon, '.');
349        region.writeIntsInto(environment, DungeonUtility.ROOM_FLOOR);
350        tempRegion.remake(region).fringe8way().writeIntsInto(environment, DungeonUtility.ROOM_WALL);
351        return dungeon;
352    }
353
354    /**
355     * Gets the most recently-produced dungeon as a 2D char array, usually produced by calling {@link #generate()} or
356     * some similar method present in a specific implementation. This normally passes a direct reference and not a copy,
357     * so you can normally modify the returned array to propagate changes back into this IDungeonGenerator.
358     *
359     * @return the most recently-produced dungeon/map as a 2D char array
360     */
361    @Override
362    public char[][] getDungeon() {
363        return dungeon;
364    }
365    /**
366     * Gets a 2D array of int constants, each representing a type of environment corresponding to a static field of
367     * DungeonUtility. This array will have the same size as the last char 2D array produced by generate(); the value
368     * of this method if called before generate() is undefined, but probably will be a 2D array of all 0 (UNTOUCHED).
369     * <ul>
370     * <li>DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED, equal to 0, is used for any cells that aren't near a floor.</li>
371     * <li>DungeonUtility.ROOM_FLOOR, equal to 1, is used for floor cells inside wide room areas.</li>
372     * <li>DungeonUtility.ROOM_WALL, equal to 2, is used for wall cells around wide room areas.</li>
373     * <li>DungeonUtility.CAVE_FLOOR, equal to 3, is used for floor cells inside rough cave areas.</li>
374     * <li>DungeonUtility.CAVE_WALL, equal to 4, is used for wall cells around rough cave areas.</li>
375     * <li>DungeonUtility.CORRIDOR_FLOOR, equal to 5, is used for floor cells inside narrow corridor areas.</li>
376     * <li>DungeonUtility.CORRIDOR_WALL, equal to 6, is used for wall cells around narrow corridor areas.</li>
377     * </ul>
378     *
379     * @return a 2D int array where each element is an environment type constant in DungeonUtility
380     */
381    public int[][] getEnvironment() {
382        return environment;
383    }
384
385}
